AEmodules module¶

AEmodules.decode_faces(ga_vector)[source]¶

This function takes as parameters a numpy array of the same size that the one returned by get_encoded_faces(), after we submitted it to a genetic algoithm for example, and returns their decoded version (by the model ‘decod_AE.h5’)

Parameters:ga_vector (numpy.ndarray) – A len(ga_vector) rows and 2048 columns array with len(ga_vector) the number of pictures we want to decode
Returns:Pixel coordinates of a set of len(ga_vector) pictures, each with dimension (128,128,3)
Return type:numpy.ndarray

Examples

>>> from keras.preprocessing import image
>>> img = image.load_img("C:/my_img.jpg, target_size = (128,128))
>>> 1_img = image.img_to_array(img)
>>> encoded_img = get_encoded_face(1_img))
>>> print(decode_faces(encoded_img).shape)
(1, 128, 128, 3)
AEmodules.get_encoded_face(my_X_test)[source]¶

This function takes as parameters a numpy array of vectorized colored 128*128 pictures and returns their encoded version (by the model ‘faces_AE.h5’) :param my_X_test: Pixel coordinates of a set of n pictures, each with dimension (128,128,3) :type my_X_test: numpy.ndarray

Returns:A n rows and 2048 columns array with n = len(my_X_test), the number of pictures encoded
Return type:numpy.ndarray

Examples

>>>from keras.preprocessing import image >>>img = image.load_img(“C:/my_img.jpg, target_size = (128,128)) >>>1_img = image.img_to_array(img) >>>print(get_encoded_face(1_img).shape) (1, 2048)

AEmodules.load_AE()[source]¶

This function loads the autoencoder model ‘faces_AE.h5’ that is saved in the same directory :param None:

Returns:Trained Auto-encoder model
Return type:keras.engine.functional.Functional
AEmodules.load_decoder()[source]¶

This function loads the decoder model ‘faces_decod.h5’ that is saved in the same directory Parameters None

Returns:Trained decoder model
Return type:keras.engine.functional.Functional
